title: Teachers’ union slams Bharathidasan University administration for not getting NAAC re-accreditation

title: Palaniswami accuses Chief Minister Stalin of using delimitation as distraction

title: Crumbling pillars of overhead tank in Thiruvizhandur pose a threat to residents
content: Installed more than 15 years ago, the 10,000-litre  tank is situated in a predominantly Scheduled Caste settlement and caters to households across four streets

title: Govt. sees ‘Visakha Economic Region’ as growth engine of A.P., aims at $120 billion economic output by 2032
content: Develop projects that will boost economic activity in the region comprising eight districts, strive to transform Visakhapatnam into another Mumbai in seven years, Chief Minister N. Chandrababu Naidu tells officials

title: Contract terminated as Aralam elephant wall project misses deadline again
content: The embankment project, launched on September 30, 2023, aimed to construct a 10-km elephant wall and a 500-metre rail fence within a year. The deadline to construct the initial 6 km was extended many times

content: As part of the agreement, the government intends to increase the share of renewables in power capacity addition

title: Madras High Court bids farewell to Justice RMT Teekaa Raman
content: With his retirement, the working strength of the High Court reduces to 58 as against its sanctioned strength of 75 judges

title: Waste menace forces KSEB to put off commissioning of Pallivasal extension project to September
content: Trash dumped into the river from Munnar town and its neighbourhood are clogging the trash rack gate at the project’s intake point, affecting water flow, and consequently, full-fledged power generation.

title: ‘Aabhyanthara Kuttavaali’ movie review: A one-sided pamphlet against Section 498A
content: ‘Aabhyanthara Kuttavaali’ falters when it generalises a few instances of women misusing Section 498A, while closing its eyes to the numerous cases of domestic abuse and dowry harassment and deaths of women which necessitated the framing of such a law

title: India, Italy agree to enhance agriculture and energy cooperation, investments
content: The two leaders and their teams also identified several opportunities for collaboration in sustainable agri-value chains, agri-machinery, food packaging technologies, and renewable energy

title: Rapido eyes Goa expansion, lauds state’s bike taxi rules
content: In an exclusive conversation with The Hindu, Pavan Guntupalli, Co-founder of Rapido, shared his insights on Goa’s regulatory framework and the company’s vision for the region

title: Heritage gets a makeover at Patiala’s Ran Baas The Palace
content: The story of the transformation of Ran Baas by The Park, arguably Punjab’s first luxury hotel, thrusts you into a princely  past

title: Bengaluru stampede: MLC K. Govindaraj sacked from CM’s political secretary post; ADGP Intelligence transferred
content: This comes a day after a number of police officers, including Bengaluru city commissioner, were suspended over the stampede at M Chinnaswamy stadium.

title: Retired judge M.S. Janarthanam passes away at 89 in Chennai
content: Tamil Nadu Chief Minister M.K. Stalin announced that the funeral of Justice Janarthanam, would be held with police honours, in recognition of his contributions to social justice

title: Malayalam writer Benyamin: Our scriptures have a lot to tell us
content: In The Second Book of Prophets, the English translation of the 2007 Malayalam novel Pravachakanmarude Randaam Pusthakam, the author, Benyamin, delves into the 1940s-50s discoveries of the Dead Sea Scrolls and                             the Nag Hammadi Library

title: City police chief reacts to Bengaluru stampede after assuming charge
content: Seemanth Kumar Singh said that the process of handing over the case to the CID is still being discussed.

title: Pakistan attacked ‘insaniyat’, Kashimiriyat in Pahalgam: PM Modi
content: The Prime Minister was speaking after flagging off the first train service to the Kashmir Valley, and inaugurating several development projects, including the world's highest railway bridge over the Chenab river.

title: Ayodhya police bust ₹3.85 crore ‘prasad’ scam carried out during Ram Temple consecration
content: The culprit had launched a fake portal just weeks before the 2024 consecration ceremony of the Ram Temple, collecting orders from more than six lakh domestic and international devotees

title: ED Kolkata arrests two in connection with online betting, gambling racket
content: The ED said in a statement that the scamsters allegedly persuaded people to contact through WhatsApp numbers for betting and gambling in different games like IPL, ISL, T20 World Cup, Online Rummy, Online Casino, etc.

title: Want to stay in a palace? At The Belgadia Palace in Mayurbhanj, dive into art, culture and history
content: Tucked away in Mayurbhanj district in Odisha, The Belgadia Palace champions the region’s art and culture, while empowering local communities. We check in, draped in marigold garlands and woven shawls

title: Chief Minister Omar Abdullah rakes up statehood issue, hopes J&K will again be State
content: The erstwhile State was reorganised into the Union Territories of Jammu and Kashmir and Ladakh following the abrogation of Article 370 in August 2019.

title: Jan Suraaj Party pitches Prashant Kishor as Bihar’s ‘most popular’ CM pick - a look at its poll strategy
content: “Bihar should forget about Nitish Kumar in the coming election” says JSP president Manoj Bharti, affirming that JSP will contest for all 243 seats

content: Questioning the rationale behind holding two felicitation functions, Union Minister H.D. Kumaraswamy said ministers, legislators and their family members were competing to take photographs with the players at Vidhana Soudha

title: Kamal Haasan files nomination for Rajya Sabha election from Tamil Nadu
content: With the DMK allocating one Rajya Sabha seat to Makkal Needhi Maiam, its founder Kamal Haasan was earlier named the candidate for the Upper House of Parliament.

title: Tension grips remote hamlet in A.P.’s Sathya Sai district, after a minor girl reported ‘pregnant’
content: Senior police personnel who visited the village launched an investigation to determine the facts behind the incident and identify those responsible.

title: Court extends Tahawwur Rana’s judicial custody till July 9
content: The court also asked the Tihar jail to submit a status report on the health condition of Rana, the alleged mastermind of the 26/11 Mumbai terror attack, by June 9, after his lawyer raised concerns about his well being

title: Political row brews over Bakrid holiday in Kerala
content: Indian Union Muslim League accuses Kerala government of attempting to implement ‘communal agenda and fascism’ in the State

title: Former Bengaluru top cop slams Karnataka government for Dayananda’s suspension
content: A day after Bengaluru stampede, Chief Minister Siddaramaiah had on June 5, 2025, suspended Mr. Dayananda and all police officials responsible for the jurisdiction near Chinnaswamy stadium.

title: New Himalayan bat blurs India-Pakistan divide
content: The Himalayan long-tailed myotis recorded in Uttarakhand matched the unidentified find of a Hungarian scientist from Khyber Pakhtunkhwa in 1998

title: 17 more people evacuated from north Sikkim as rescue operations resume
content: The state government has arranged buses to transport the rescued people from the airport to Gangtok from where they would leave for their onward destinations, the official said.

title: Satyendar Jain appears before ACB for questioning in classroom construction case
content: Before leaving for the ACB office, Mr. Jain had asserted that the previous AAP government in the national capital worked towards improving the city's education, while the current BJP government was only doing politics.

content: On June 5, Chief Minister Siddaramaiah chaired a Cabinet meeting and took stock of the developments in the aftermath of the stampede

title: Bengaluru stampede: Karnataka High Court restrains police from taking any coercive step against KSCA’s president, secretary and treasurer
content: KSCA argued that it was the call of the State Government as it facilitated the players in front of Vidhan Soudha in the presence of Chief Minister, Deputy Chief Minister and several Cabinet ministers

title: Telangana Cabinet to meet twice a month to accelerate policy implementation; earlier met once in 2-3 months
content: The Chief Minister is of the view that frequent cabinet meetings would allow ministers to engage in ongoing reviews and make necessary corrections and interventions in real-time

title: PM Modi inaugurates world’s highest rail bridge over Chenab river in J&K
content: Accompanied by Union Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw and Jitendra Singh and Chief Minister Omar Abdullah, the Prime Minister visited a railway museum set up near the iconic bridge

title: Thennala Balakrishna Pillai, veteran Congress leader and former KPCC president, passes away
content: Bolstered by his reputation for honesty and non-partisanship, Thennala Balakrishna Pillai proved effective in managing factional undercurrents in Congress in Kerala

title: Rise in repatriation sign of mature market: RBI Governor on moderation in net FDI
content: The moderation in net FDI "is on account of a rise in repatriation and net outward FDI, while gross FDI actually increased by 14 per cent," Mr. Malhotra said, while unveiling the June monetary policy.

title: Assam flood situation remains bleak, over 5.6 lakh affected
content: Wildlife has also been affected with nearly 70% of the Pobitora Wildlife Sanctuary in Morigaon district facing inundation, an official said

title: Don’t like women wearing short clothes, says M.P. Minister Vijayvargiya at Indore event
content: Kailash Vijayvargiya made the remarks while comparing short speeches of leaders with the short clothes of women

title: 'Rajnath Aam': New mango variety named after Defence Minister

title: Madras High Court refuses to order re-conduct of NEET-UG 2025 for candidates affected by power outage
content: Justice C. Kumarappan says, nearly 22 lakh candidates had appeared for the test this year and hence, any such order would seriously affect the level playing field

title: PM Modi lauds Yuva Shakti for driving India’s growth
content: ‘Government initiatives like StartUp India, Skill India, Digital India and the National Education Policy 2020 are rooted in the firm belief that empowering youth is the most powerful thing a nation can do,’ says PM Modi

title: Man who raped toddler near Lucknow metro station killed in police encounter
content: Late Thursday, June 5, police received information that the accused was about to flee. A team reached the spot and tried to stop him, but the accused opened fire, a police officer claimed.

title: Kashmir rail link example of continuity in governance which PM never acknowledges: Congress
content: Congress general secretary in-charge communications Jairam Ramesh said governance involves great continuity, "a fact consistently denied by Prime Minister Narendra Modi in his perennial desire for self-glory".

title: Malayalam actor Shine Tom Chacko’s father killed in accident in Tamil Nadu; actor injured

title: Properties of rape accused razed in Bihar, locals dub it 'bulldozer justice model'

content: The Prime Minister had earlier flagged off the Vande Bharat train service to Srinagar, which is set to begin on June 7

title: Bengaluru stampede: Top RCB official and 3 from event management company arrested
content: The arrests came hours after Chief Minister Siddaramaiah announced at a press conference the suspension of city police commissioner B. Dayananda and directed police to arrest RCB and the KSCA for the stampede.

title: Hindi speakers’ society takes the lead to celebrate centenary of Ritwik Ghatak
content: On June 8, Paschim Banga Hindi Bhashi Samaj (West Bengal Hindi Speakers’ Society), will hold a screening of Ghatak’s film Subarnarekha

title: Judge, jury and torturer: A flagrant case of police highhandedness in A.P.’s Tenali
content: The recent incident of two police personnel beating up three youth in Guntur’s Tenali in public to ‘teach them a lesson’ for allegedly attacking a constable in Andhra underscores the need to establish robust mechanisms of accountability to ensure all individuals in conflict with the law are treated justly and with dignity, writes P. Sujatha Varma

title: Andhra Pradesh reports 19 new COVID cases in a day
content: This is the biggest 24-hour jump in the State since the first case was reported from Visakhapatnam on May 20; active caseload now stands at 50

title: A museum in search of a forever home in Telangana
content: A rare private collection of tribal instruments and totemic relics gathered from across Telangana over five decades by ethnographer Jayadheer Tirumala Rao have long searched for a permanent address. When Osmania University, Hyderabad, finally offered space, student protests stopped the move. Now, caught between legacy and land politics, the museum’s future hangs in the balance. Serish Nanisetti traces the journey

title: 3-year-old girl sleeping under metro station in Uttar Pradesh raped, in critical condition
content: The accused took the girl away while her parents were sleeping and raped her at a secluded place, police said

title: Malnad farmers, planters struggle to weather the storm
content: From droughts to early monsoons to heavier-than-usual pre- and post-monsoon rains, vagaries of the weather in Karnataka’s high rainfall regions are altering farming timelines and yields, find K.C. Deepika and Sathish G.T.

title: J&K: Security forces conduct inspections in Ramban ahead of PM Modi's visit to Katra
content: Security personnel conducted sweeping inspections, including dog squad deployments and comprehensive vehicle checks. Security was also heightened at the Udhampur Railway Station

title: KTR helps bring body of BRS worker who died in Saudi Arabia
content: Babya, a BRS worker and farmer, had left for Saudi Arabia a year ago for a job. He succumbed to a heart attack on May 27

title: India's multi-party delegation holds 'comprehensive' discussions with U.S. Vice-President Vance
content: The conversation focused on strengthening the India-U.S. partnership, including cooperation in counter-terrorism domain, says the Indian Embassy in the U.S in a post on X

title: Karnataka launches district officers’ upskilling initiative with Infosys partnership
content: Sharan Prakash Patil, Minister for Medical Education, Skill Development, Entrepreneurship & Livelihood, inaugurated the programme through videoconferencing from the Vikasa Soudha

title: YSRCP demands probe into ‘irregularities’ in SSC exam evaluation
content: The YSRCP student wing criticised the government, holding Mr. Lokesh directly responsible for gross mismanagement in the evaluation of answer scripts.

title: Monsoon: Gear up to tackle any eventuality, says Chief Secretary
content: Mr. Vijayanand said in the event of cyclones, heavy rains and floods, efforts should be made to minimise the loss of property and lives, and establish normal conditions promptly

title: Citing ‘unjust racial discrimination’, Trump grants asylum to White Afrikaners
content: The decision to grant asylum to white Afrikaners comes on the heels of the Trump administration halting other refugee admissions from war-torn countries such as DR Congo, Myanmar, Afghanistan, and Palestine

title: A.P. govt. sets target to increase green cover to 50% by 2047

title: Supriya Sule could not sign letter for special Parliament sessions, urges Congress to wait

title: Mumbai-Nagpur expressway now operational, cuts travel time by 10 hours
content: The road will open up new avenues since 24 districts of Maharashtra have now been connected with JNPT port and will soon be connected to Vadhavan port

title: On a wing and a prayer: India’s quest to manufacture training aircraft
content: The CSIR-National Aerospace Laboratories has, for nearly three decades, worked on perfecting the two-seater Hansa aircraft for commercial manufacture. This year, it has inked a deal with a private company that will manufacture the planes. Jacob Koshy explores why despite having research capabilities, India is still struggling to manufacture training aircraft

title: Security forces launch operation along India-Myanmar border in Arunachal Pradesh
content: “While moving through the thick forest, the patrol observed the movement of unknown individuals. In response, the patrol drew heavy and indiscriminate fire from heavy-calibre weapons, which was effectively retaliated by the security forces,” according to the Defence Ministry.

title: Ram Temple moves towards completion, idol of ‘Raja Ram’ consecrated
content: While Prime Minister Narendra Modi, the top government brass and a host of celebrities were present at the consecration of Ram Lalla, the child god, on January 22, 2024, the event this time was quieter

title: Stalin hands over appointment orders to 1,304 forest staff
content: An event to celebrate World Environment Day was organised by the Departments of Environment, Climate Change, and Forests

title: 'Resilient': Haliburton's late shot sinks OKC in G1
content: Tyrese Haliburton scored with 0.3 left for Indiana's first and only lead of the game and the Pacers beat the Thunder 111-110 in Game 1 of the NBA Finals.

title: OKC on Game 1 collapse: 'We've been here before'
content: After Thursday night's dramatic loss, the Thunder pointed to their collapse against the Nuggets in Round 2 as proof they can bounce back from heartbreaking Game 1 setbacks.

title: QB Rodgers agrees to 1-year deal with Steelers
content: QB Aaron Rodgers agreed to terms on a one-year deal with the Steelers, the team announced on Thursday night.

title: Canady's 'huge' outing lifts TTU to G2 win over UT
content: NiJaree Canady scattered six hits and pitched her way out of a seventh-inning jam, and Texas Tech forced a decisive third game in the Women's College World Series with a 4-3 victory over Texas on Thursday night.

title: Silver: Owners likely to urge exploring expansion
content: NBA commissioner Adam Silver said he believes there is enough interest among league owners to begin "a more formal exploratory phase" of expansion.

title: Reports: David Beckham to be given knighthood
content: Manchester United legend David Beckham will be given a knighthood in King Charles' birthday honors list, according to British media reports.

title: Twin sister of Alabama freshman QB Russell dies
content: Kierston Russell, the twin sister of Alabama freshman quarterback Keelon Russell, died Wednesday, according to a statement from Tuscaloosa police officials.

title: 'No sir': Ravens asst. Pagano done with being HC
content: Former Colts head coach Chuck Pagano, who ended his four-year retirement to become an assistant with the Ravens, says he has no desire to be an NFL head coach again.

content: The Steelers finally landed Rodgers after months of anticipation. But can the move actually improve the offense? Let's grade the signing.

content: Not only did the Bears hire an offensive-minded head coach in Ben Johnson, but they signed Case Keenum to mentor Williams.

content: He defeated No. 3 Zverev in the quarterfinals -- but can Djokovic continue this level? In his way stands Sinner, and likely Alcaraz too.

content: The league will feature four teams and a touring model that will serve as a "tryout" for prospective home cities next season.

content: Despite back-to-back 50-win seasons, whispers about Tom Thibodeau's future in New York had percolated for months.

title: 'I do record everything': The told and untold stories of Merab Dvalishvili
content: Merab Dvalishvili, the UFC champion Dana White once called "next-level stupid," is slowly taking over the internet.

title: Barcelona keep or dump: What do Yamal & Co. need to build on success?
content: Barcelona returned to the top of LaLiga under new coach Hansi Flick. What moves should they make to avoid a step back in 2025-26?

title: Arsenal's Gabriel signs new four-year contract
content: Arsenal defender Gabriel Magalhães has signed a new long-term contract, keeping him at the club for four years.

title: Yamal makes Ballon d'Or 'statement' in Spain win
content: Spain coach Luis de la Fuente says Lamine Yamal delivered a Ballon d'Or "statement" in Thursday's 5-4 UEFA Nations League semifinal win over France.

title: Robertson: McTominay wanted to prove Utd wrong
content: Andy Robertson has said Scotland teammate Scott McTominay was powered to an award-winning season at Napoli by his desire to "prove Manchester United wrong."

title: Sources: Madrid to pay $45M Mastantuono release
content: Real Madrid are close to completing the signing of River Plate star Franco Mastantuono, sources have told ESPN, with the playmaker expected to arrive in August, after playing for River at the Club World Cup.

title: Matic, Hassan banned for hiding anti-LGBTQ+ sign
content: Lyon's Nemanja Matic and Le Havre's Ahmed Hassan have been handed two-game bans after they concealed Ligue 1's anti-homophobia sign on their shirts.

title: Dest latest USMNT absentee in Gold Cup roster
content: United States international and PSV Eindhoven defender Sergiño Dest is the latest USMNT player to pull out of the Concacaf Gold Cup.

title: ⚽ Top 100 men's soccer players in the world
content: It's that time again: with the UEFA Champions League final behind us and the 2024-25 season officially over, it's time to rank the top 100 players in the world of men's soccer right now. Welcome to the FC 100.

title: How members of the Pasadena Run Club are finding salvation in a post-wildfire world
content: Though still reeling from the Eaton fire, a group of L.A. area runners are determined to build a worthwhile future.

title: Ranking every WNBA team's roster core, 1-13: Which team has the best young players?
content: Let's stack every WNBA team's core by the youth of its roster, leading off with the Fever and Caitlin Clark.

title: Power Rankings: Dream ride four-game winning streak to move up in Week 3 edition
content: Las Vegas, Washington and Chicago join Atlanta as risers as the league begins Commissioner's Cup play.

title: PLL Week 2 preview: Everything you need to know for Chaos homecoming
content: The PLL heads to Charlotte for four games. Check here for the full schedule, key stats, injury notes and more.

title: Plucked from Dunkin', QB J'Mar Smith leads the Stallions into the playoffs
content: Smith, a former Stallions signal-caller, had given up on football before a string of injuries brought about his return.

title: Tyrese Haliburton's all-white button up leads stylish arrivals to Game 1 of the NBA Finals
content: Before the Finals could tip off, stars from both teams looked to set the tone in the pre-game tunnel.

title: Pacers, Thunder is latest matchup that includes long championship drought
content: This year is the second NBA Finals in which both participants are on title droughts that exceed 40 years.

title: Meet the QBs in the 2026 NFL draft class: Strengths, weaknesses for 22 intriguing prospects
content: Will Cade Klubnik, LaNorris Sellers or Drew Allar be QB1 in next year's draft? And who are the other names to know in the class?

title: Ranking the top 64 NHL draft prospects, including projected ceilings and floors
content: There is no hockey left to be played this season for the top players available June 27-28. Here's how they stack up.

title: 'Simla pact not dead': Pakistan corrects own defence minister's bold claim
content: Following defence minister Khawaja Asif's declaration, Pakistan's foreign ministry clarified that no decision has been made to revoke bilateral agreements with India, including the Simla Agreement. This comes amid heightened tensions after recent terror attacks and Indian strikes. While internal discussions occurred, all treaties remain operational, distancing the government from Asif's remarks that the Simla framework is obsolete.

title: Tejasvi 'thanks' K'taka CM, DKS for 'winning' IPL; Kohli gets a mention
content: Following the Bengaluru stampede that tragically killed 11 people, BJP MP Tejasvi Surya sarcastically targeted the Karnataka government, led by Chief Minister Siddaramaiah and Deputy CM DK Shivakumar. He mockingly credited them for Royal Challengers Bengaluru’s (RCB) anticipated IPL victory.

title: Musk vs Trump: How Elon Musk's 'Big bomb' on Donald Trump may not really be so; Reason is …
content: Elon Musk alleges that Donald Trump's name appears in the Jeffrey Epstein files. He suggests this is why the files remain unreleased. Trump's association with Epstein is previously documented. Trump's name was already on a list of individuals linked to the Epstein scandal. Documents contain no allegations of wrongdoing by Trump. Musk's claims follow a series of attacks on Trump.

title: Tragedy on tracks: Cricketer dies in pain on train
content: Vikram Singh, a disabled cricketer, tragically died on the Chhattisgarh Express en route to a tournament after experiencing severe pain. Despite urgent calls for medical assistance, help failed to arrive in time, leading to his death before reaching Mathura station. The incident has sparked outrage and raised serious questions about the Indian Railways' emergency medical response capabilities for disabled passengers.

title: B'luru stampede: KSCA officials get protection from arrest
content: The Karnataka High Court has restrained the state government from taking coercive action against KSCA officials, following an FIR filed in connection with the Chinnaswamy Stadium stampede. Justice SR Krishna Kumar's order mandates cooperation with the ongoing investigation and restricts travel outside the court's jurisdiction. The FIR, registered by Bengaluru Police, also names RCB and DNA entertainment private limited.

title: Musk vs Trump feud: 10 ways they can destroy each other — legally
content: Trump, fresh off a fiscal sobriety bender and looking for budgetary scapegoats, has a new mantra: “No woke space toys on my dime.” He’s already floated cutting $3 billion worth of contracts to Musk’s empire. That’s not just pruning—it's taking a chainsaw to the money tree. Tesla loses its tax credits. Starlink gets kicked out of the Pentagon's good books. SpaceX is told to sit in the corner while Blue Origin waves from the Oval Office with a smug Bezos smirk. This isn’t just defunding—this is strategic neutering.

title: Smartphone wars: Steve Ballmer may have agreed with Android co-founder; Gates cost Microsoft $400B
content: Former Microsoft CEO Steve Ballmer acknowledged that overconfidence in Windows led to the company's failure in the smartphone market. He admitted Microsoft tried forcing Windows into unsuitable areas like mobile and automotive, resulting in poor user experiences.

title: Caste census, Trump's claims: Rahul again takes 'surrender' jab at PM
content: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi has accused Prime Minister Narendra Modi of having a habit of surrendering, citing US President Donald Trump's claims of brokering peace between India and Pakistan. Gandhi reiterated his commitment to a caste census and removing the 50% cap on reservation, promising to initiate it from Bihar if his party forms the government.

title: Netanyahu admits Israel backing anti-Hamas armed group in Gaza
content: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu admitted to supporting an armed faction in Gaza that opposes Hamas, despite criticism and warnings about empowering a criminal gang. This group, allegedly led by Yasser Abu Shabab, has been accused of looting aid, further destabilizing the region already facing a humanitarian crisis.

title: 'I'm still heavily committed to Delhi Capitals': Starc after leaving IPL midway
content: Mitchell Starc remains dedicated to Delhi Capitals in the IPL, despite opting out of the tournament's resumption due to security concerns following events in Dharamsala. He cited unease before a match near the border and differing handling of the situation among teams as factors. Starc prioritized red-ball cricket and the upcoming World Test Championship final.

title: Will AI replace engineers? Google CEO Sundar Pichai says: "I expect we will..."
content: Sundar Pichai, Alphabet CEO, announced Google's plans to expand its engineering workforce through 2026, countering fears of AI-driven job losses. Pichai views AI as an accelerator, enhancing engineer productivity and enabling Google to pursue opportunities in areas like autonomous vehicles and YouTube's global expansion. This commitment signals a shift towards growth-focused investment in human capital.

title: 'Torn shirts hung on barbed wire': Staff pick up pieces of deadly stampede
content: Following Royal Challengers Bengaluru's IPL victory, a tragic stampede during the success parade at M Chinnaswamy Stadium claimed 11 lives. The aftermath revealed scenes of chaos, with damaged infrastructure and discarded belongings scattered throughout the stadium and surrounding areas. Medical teams faced challenges in reaching the injured due to the overwhelming crowd and opportunistic individuals.

title: RCB's parent company Diageo maintain silence on Bengaluru stampede
content: Following the tragic stampede at Royal Challengers Bengaluru's victory parade, which resulted in 11 deaths and 75 injuries, Diageo, RCB's parent company, has remained silent. On the ground, Bengaluru Police have arrested RCB's marketing head and three others while the government have started an investigation led by a former Karnataka High Court judge.

title: Rodgers' deal with Pittsburgh Steelers remains confidential as NFL insider hints
content: Veteran NFL player Aaron Rodgers is set to join the Pittsburgh Steelers for the upcoming season, following his departure from the New York Jets. NFL insider Gerry Dulac revealed that Rodgers' contract is a one-year deal for less than $20 million. Rodgers also recently discussed his strained relationship with his father on a podcast.

title: Not a biscuit, a luxury! Gaza dad pays Rs 2,300 for Parle-G gift; viral video
content: Parle-G biscuits, an Indian staple, have become a costly luxury in war-torn Gaza, symbolising extreme scarcity. A Palestinian's social media post revealed he paid over Rs 2,300 for a pack usually costing less than Rs 5 in India. His post quickly went viral on social media with many Indian users tagging government officials and the Parle company for help.

title: Bengaluru stampede: K'taka CM's political secy sacked
content: K Govindaraju has been removed from his position as Political Secretary to Karnataka Chief Minister Siddaramaiah, effective immediately. The state government issued a notification on Friday confirming the decision. Govindaraju, a well-known political figure in Karnataka and a close confidant of Siddaramaiah, had held the post since the Congress government assumed power.

title: Bakrid 2025 Wishes: Heartfelt Eid Mubarak messages, quotes & images to celebrate Eid-ul-Adha
content: Eid-ul-Adha, or Bakrid, commemorates Prophet Ibrahim's devotion and is celebrated globally with prayers, feasts, and charity. The festival emphasizes sharing love and blessings through heartfelt messages. The article provides a collection of Eid Mubarak wishes, quotes, and greetings suitable for family, friends, and colleagues, aiming to enhance the spirit of unity and joy during this sacred occasion.

title: J&K: 'Pakistan is against rozi-roti of Kashmiris, says PM Modi
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi inaugurated infrastructure projects worth Rs 44,000 crore in Jammu and Kashmir, including the Chenab and Anji bridges. He also flagged off two Vande Bharat Express trains between Katra and Srinagar, significantly improving rail connectivity to the Kashmir Valley. The USBRL project establishes all-weather rail connectivity, aiming to transform regional mobility and improve socio-economic integration.

title: Chiefs’ Jaylon Moore’s wife calls out Donald Trump for putting women’s lives at risk
content: Sidney Moore, wife of Kansas City Chiefs' Jaylon Moore and a registered nurse, has publicly condemned the Trump administration's rollback of a federal mandate requiring hospitals to perform emergency abortions when a woman's life is at risk. Moore expressed her outrage on Instagram, highlighting concerns about patient safety and women's rights, drawing from her healthcare experience and motherhood.

title: 'The job is still half done': Zinta speaks out for first time after PBKS' IPL 2025 final loss
content: Following Punjab Kings' defeat in the IPL final, co-owner Preity Zinta addressed fans. She praised the team's resilience and the performance of young Indian players. Zinta acknowledged the season's challenges, including injuries and relocations. She thanked the 'Sher Squad' for their support. Zinta promised a stronger comeback in the next IPL season.

title: Musk-Trump feud: Harsh Goenka shares ‘funny’ take; says ‘Trump is now Elon’s…’
content: Billionaire Harsh Goenka humorously commented on the escalating feud between Donald Trump and Elon Musk, highlighting their strained relationship. Musk criticized Trump's "One Big Beautiful Bill" as a "disgusting abomination," warning against potential American bankruptcy due to federal overspending.

title: 'Will conquer this war': Yuzvendra Chahal sends strong message
content: Yuzvendra Chahal remains optimistic despite Punjab Kings' narrow defeat to Royal Challengers Bengaluru in the IPL final. Chahal expressed confidence in the team's future, stating they will conquer the title in 2026. RCB ended their 18-year wait for the trophy, defeating Punjab by six runs in a thrilling match, with Virat Kohli playing a key role in their victory.

title: 'I got demoted': J&K CM rakes up statehood issue as PM Modi looks on
content: Omar Abdullah urged Prime Minister Narendra Modi to restore statehood to Jammu and Kashmir during the Vande Bharat Express launch between Srinagar and Katra. Abdullah reminisced about the 2014 Katra railway station inauguration, highlighting the progress made under Modi's leadership.

title: HC judge gets death threats on 'X' after denying bail to influencer Sharmishtha
content: Following Justice Partha Sarathi Chatterjee's denial of interim bail to a social media influencer in a hate-speech case, death threats surfaced on X, prompting concerns and calls for police intervention. Subsequently, a vacation bench granted the student bail, citing errors in the arrest warrant and directing police protection due to received threats.

title: ‘No father should see this’: Heartbreaking story of pani puri vendor who lost son in stampede
content: Devaraj NT, a pani puri vendor, is devastated by the loss of his 18-year-old son, Manoj Kumar, a BBM student and ardent cricket fan. Manoj went to celebrate Royal Challengers Bengaluru's IPL win with friends but tragically never returned.

title: 'A feeling I'm not very used to': Gill ahead of his first press conference as Test captain - Watch
content: Star batter Shubman Gill is the new Test captain for Team India. He attended his first press conference with coach Gautam Gambhir on Thursday. Gill spoke about the responsibility of captaincy. He never imagined leading the team. India will play a five-match Test series in England. The series begins in June 2025. Rishabh Pant is the vice-captain.

title: Big cheer! How much will 1% RBI repo rate cut reduce your loan EMI?
content: The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) has significantly reduced the repo rate by 50 basis points, bringing the total cut to 1% since February, a move set to lower home loan EMIs. Experts suggest this could push home loan rates closer to sub-8%, benefiting borrowers.

title: 'Call me fugitive but not chor': Vijay Mallya apologises for Kingfisher failure
content: Vijay Mallya has publicly apologized for Kingfisher Airlines' collapse, denying theft allegations during a recent podcast. He defended his decision to stay in the UK, claiming he didn't 'run away' but left on a pre-scheduled visit.

title: Boost for Starlink! Musk's firm gets licence in India; 3rd after Jio & OneWeb
content: Starlink, owned by Elon Musk, has secured a crucial license from India's Department of Telecommunications, a key milestone in its proposed commercial launch in the country. Following OneWeb and Reliance Jio, Starlink is the third entity authorized to provide satellite internet services.

title: Kashmir gets rail connectivity: Chenab bridge to special Vande Bharat trains
content: USBRL, Chenab bridge, Vande Bharat Express inauguration: Prime Minister Narendra Modi inaugurated a key section of the Udhampur–Srinagar–Baramulla Rail Link (USBRL) project, connecting Kashmir to the rest of India via an all-weather railway line. The project includes the world's highest railway arch bridge, the Chenab Bridge, and India's first cable-stayed bridge, the Anji Khad Bridge.

title: Friends to foes? How Trump-Musk ties soured; 11 things they said about each other in 24 hours
content: A public feud erupted between Donald Trump and Elon Musk after Musk criticized Trump's economic bill. Trump retaliated by threatening to revoke government subsidies, while Musk accused Trump of deception and failed leadership. The clash escalated with Musk teasing third-party politics and backing calls for Trump's impeachment.

title: Piyush Chawla retirement: India's two-time World Cup winner retires, says 'time has come to bid adieu'
content: Piyush Chawla, the veteran leg-spinner, has retired after two decades in Indian cricket. He represented India in both the 2007 T20 and 2011 ODI World Cups. Chawla thanks his family, IPL teams, and fans for their support. He played for Uttar Pradesh and various IPL franchises, including Kolkata Knight Riders.

title: Meghalaya murder: CCTV shows couple leaving hotel; wife missing, husband later found dead
content: CCTV footage shows an Indore couple checking out of a Meghalaya hotel before their disappearance. Raja Raghuvanshi's body was found in a gorge, murdered with a machete. His brother believes Sonam is alive and abducted, urging authorities to investigate accordingly as the search continues and the motive remains unclear.

title: 'He was...': Rohit reveals father's reaction on Test retirement; recollects his words after he scored 264 runs
content: Rohit Sharma revealed his father's mixed reaction to his Test retirement, acknowledging his disappointment but also understanding. Sharma emphasized his father's deep appreciation for Test cricket, recalling his detailed discussions about his Test innings, even more so than his ODI achievements.

title: Bengaluru stampede: What we know so far on RCB's celebrations that turned catastrophic
content: Royal Challengers Bengaluru's IPL victory celebrations turned tragic as a stampede at M Chinnaswamy Stadium resulted in 11 deaths and 75 injuries. FIRs have been filed against RCB, events organisers DNA, and Karnataka State Cricket Association for alleged negligence. The Karnataka High Court has sought a report from the government while arrests have been and officials suspended.

title: RBI MPC meet: FD rates set to fall after repo rate cut; what should investors do?
content: The Reserve Bank of India has significantly reduced the repo rate by 50 basis points to 5.5%, accompanied by a 1% decrease in the Cash Reserve Ratio, injecting substantial liquidity into the banking system. While borrowers can anticipate cheaper loans, fixed deposit investors face the prospect of declining interest rates.

title: Maharashtra FYJC 2025 first merit list released; check direct link here
content: The Maharashtra School Education Department has released the FYJC 2025 first provisional merit list on June 6, 2025, at mahafyjcadmissions.in. Over 10.85 lakh students applied for 20.43 lakh seats across 9,281 junior colleges in eight regional divisions. The list currently includes students scoring between 400 and 500 marks. Candidates can log in to check their status and submit objections if needed. The final merit list and seat allotment will follow soon.

title: Meerut horror: Headless body of 17-year-old girl found in canal
content: A headless body of a 17-year-old Class 12 student was discovered in a Meerut canal after she went missing on Wednesday. The girl, a resident of Daurala, was identified by her mother and brother. Police have registered a murder case and detained three relatives for questioning, suspecting the involvement of a close family member in the crime.

title: 41 victims, 110 accounts: Ex-ICICI bank employee stole crores; here's how she fooled everyone
content: Sakshi Gupta, a former bank relationship manager in Kota, has been arrested for allegedly siphoning off over Rs 4.58 crore from customer accounts between 2020 and 2023. She accessed over 110 accounts, redirected funds into stock market investments, and concealed the fraud by changing mobile numbers linked to the accounts.

title: 'Ramp up pressure': Russia rains 400 drones on Ukraine; Zelenskyy urges action
content: President Zelenskyy reported a large-scale Russian attack involving over 400 drones and 40 missiles, urging Ukraine's allies for immediate and decisive action to halt the war. The Ukrainian Foreign Ministry echoed this call, emphasizing the urgent need to increase international pressure on Moscow following the deadly assault on civilians. Zelenskyy stated inaction equates to complicity in the ongoing conflict.

title: NEET PG 2025 exam date postponed to August 3, to be held in a single shift
content: The NEET PG 2025 exam has been postponed to August 3 following a Supreme Court extension granted to the National Board of Examinations. The court directed the exam be held in a single shift to ensure fairness and transparency. NBEMS announced the delay to expand test centres and upgrade infrastructure. The Supreme Court rejected NBE’s two-shift plan citing arbitrariness and mandated no further extensions. This ensures a level playing field for all candidates, as reported by ANI.

title: Yash Dayal: 'Whatever is done for Virat (Kohli) bhaiya is very less'
content: Royal Challengers Bengaluru (RCB) pacer Yash Dayal, in a free-wheeling chat with TimesofIndia.com, has opened up about winning the IPL trophy, burying the Ahmedabad ghost, explaining why he feels Virat Kohli deserves more, and the learnings from Josh Hazlewood. Dayal took 13 wickets for RCB and forged one of the strongest pace attacks with Josh Hazlewood and Bhuvneshwar Kumar in IPL 2025.

title: Bengaluru stampede: Cleaning staff collect 150 bags of footwear stained with dried blood
content: The Chinnaswamy Stadium bore witness to a tragic scene following a chaotic event, with cleaning staff discovering around 150 bags of discarded footwear, some stained with blood. Workers recounted the harrowing experience, describing the scene as a 'war zone,' particularly disturbed by children's footwear.

title: Buzz: What will Aaron Rodgers' arrival mean for Steelers' skill players?
content: Aaron Rodgers is headed to the Steelers, but expectations of a return to fantasy greatness should be tempered.

title: Buxton goes 20/20? Rockies bats rebound in a big way? Don't be surprised
content: Eric Karabell looks into the crystal ball to tell fantasy baseball managers what might come to pass in the not-too-distant future.

title: Vick, Iverson ... Keyshawn? Norfolk roots connect Davis to sports legends
content: Michael Vick, Allen Iverson, Pernell Whitaker... and Keyshawn Davis? Meet the newest face in sports to come out of Norfolk, Virginia.

title: Golf odds: Scottie Scheffler the betting favorite in each of the next four majors
content: Odds for next four golf majors: 2025 U.S. Open, 2025 Open Championship, 2026 Masters and 2026 PGA Championship

title: 2025 Belmont Stakes: Odds, post positions for Saturday's race
content: Preakness winner Journalism and Kentucky Derby winner Sovereignty have the best odds in the 8-horse field.

title: What we're hearing in the transfer window: Chelsea eye Ekitike; Man United out of Osimhen race
content: The summer transfer window is now open, but what are our reporters hearing about deals that could be done? Get the latest every Friday.

title: Rs 230-Crore Mystery: Are 50,000 'Ghost' Employees Haunting Madhya Pradesh's Treasury?
content: The salaries of 50,000 government employees, that is nearly nine per cent of Madhya Pradesh's government taskforce, have not been paid for over six months.

title: PM Invited To G7 Summit In Canada's Kananaskis This Month
content: In a big sign of India-Canada ties healing after hitting an all-time low under former prime minister Justin Trudeau, his successor Mark Carney has invited Prime Minister Narendra Modi for the G7 summit in the country later this month.

title: Delhi Chief Minister Rekha Gupta Gets Death Threat, Security Increased
content: Delhi Chief Minister Rekha Gupta's security was increased on Friday after a caller issued a death threat by dialling up the police control room in the neighbouring city of Ghaziabad, an official said.

title: Opinion: Opinion | Musk-Trump Saga is Not A Biblical Or Pop Culture Event. It's Dangerous
content: If the James Bond movies are to be trusted, your most vicious enemy happens to be a jilted lover or a close accomplice.

title: Axiom-4 Spaceflight Mission Commander's Message For PM Modi
content: The director of human spaceflight at Axiom Dr Peggy A Whitson has a message for Prime Minister Narendra Modi - the integration of commercial and government space programmes is the future.

title: "Case Filed, Inquiry On. What More Can Government Do?" DK Shivakumar On Stampede Probe
content: An inquiry has been ordered. Cases have been filed. People have been suspended. Karnataka Deputy Chief Minister DK Shivakumar spotlighted these to underscore that his government is doing all it can in the tragic Bengaluru stampede deaths case.

title: Elon Musk's Starlink Gets Licence For Satcom Services In India: Report
content: Elon Musk's Starlink has got licence for satcom services in India, Press Trust of India reported quoting sources.

title: What Are The Epstein Files Elon Musk Referred To In Feud With Trump
content: As Elon Musk and Donald Trump traded barbs publicly on Thursday, an unlikely name emerged, putting the US President on a spot. The name was Jeffrey Epstein, the late convicted sex offender.

title: Satellite Data Shows Manipur Lost 52,000 Acres Of Forest In 4 Four Years: Study
content: Manipur lost a staggering 52,000 acres of forest area in just four years between 2021 and 2025, a study by space analytics firm Suhora said.

title: Netanyahu Admits Israel Supporting Anti-Hamas Armed Group In Gaza
content: Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu admitted that Israel is supporting an armed group in Gaza that opposes the Hamas, following comments by a former minister that Israel had transferred weapons to it.

title: "Oh It's Okay": Trump Says Of Musk Political Marriage Meltdown
content: US President Donald Trump said "Oh it's okay," when asked about his very public breakup with former ally and donor Elon Musk, POLITICO reported.

title: Russia Faces Struggle To Replace Bombers Lost In Ukrainian Drone Strikes
content: Russia will take years to replace nuclear-capable bomber planes that were hit in Ukrainian drone strikes last weekend, straining a modernisation programme that is already delayed.

title: Hungary Bans LGBTQ Symbols On Government Buildings
content: Hungarian Prime Minister Viktor Orban prohibited the display of symbols "referring to or promoting" sexual minorities on government buildings, hours before the 30th Budapest Pride festival formally opens on Friday.

title: Does Escalating Spat With Trump Pose Regulatory Threat For Musk Businesses?
content: The risk US transportation, environmental, communications and other regulators will take aim at Elon Musk's many businesses became a real threat after the billionaire's deep political ties with President Donald Trump disintegrated.

title: No Plans For Trump-Musk Call Today: White House Source
content: There are no plans for US President Donald Trump to hold a call with Elon Musk on Friday, a White House source said.

title: Cousins Qualify For Medical Entrance A Year Apart. Forms Had Same Photo
content: A Munnabhai MBBS in the making? Two cousins, two years apart ace the tough medical entrance examination or the NEET and secure admissions. Five years later, it now appears that their admission forms had different names but carried the same picture.

title: Why Indian Railways Deactivated 2.5 Crore "Bogus" IDs On IRCTC
content: A Railways official shared that 134 complaints were registered with the national cybercrime portal and they have blocked more than 6,800 email domains.

title: Karnataka Cricket Body Officials Get High Court Relief In Stampede Case
content: The Karnataka High Court on Friday, in an interim order, directed the state police not to take any coercive action against the office bearers of KSCA in connection with the stampede outside the Chinnaswamy stadium here which claimed 11 lives.

title: Opinion: Opinion | Breaking: Female Star Foolishly Assumes She's An Equal - On Deepika-Vanga Clash
content: The incident has assumed such dramatic inflexions that it could be straight out of Vanga's films. Sample the premise: slighted by a woman, man rages in public.

title: Jharkhand Woman Gives Birth To Boy After Hospital Declares Foetus Died In Womb, Probe Launched
content: The Hazaribag district administration has ordered an inquiry after a woman in labour was allegedly denied admission to a government hospital, where nurses declared that her baby had died in the womb, but she later gave birth to a boy.

title: Sources: Man Utd increase offer for Mbeumo
content: Gab Marcotti reacts to Jadon Sancho's decision to return to Man United after his loan at Chelsea. (0:44) Manchester United  have upped their offer for  Brentford  forward  Bryan Mbeumo , sources have told ESPN. United have already seen the offer of an overall package of around £55 million ($74.5m) knocked back by Brentford. Sources have told ESPN that the improved offer is worth more than £60m. United are pushing to get the deal done as quickly as possible. They've already agreed to trigger the £62.5m release clause in  Matheus Cunha 's contract at Wolves. The Brazilian will formally complete his move to Old Trafford after the international break. Mbeumo, who scored 20  Premier League  goals last season, is next on Ruben Amorim's list as he looks to cure his team's goalscoring problems. According to sources, club bosses have been made aware that the 25-year-old favours a move to United despite interest from Newcastle.

title: To succeed at Western Kentucky, Tyson Helton seeks gunslingers
content: western Kentucky head coach Tyson Helton evaluates a quarterback . he says he wants a player completely unaffected by the moment . "there's not one damn great quarterback who don't walk up there like John Wayne," helton says .

title: 10 ways to make your fantasy league more fun
content: more than 13 million people played fantasy football on the ESPN platform last season, organized into approximately 2 million leagues . each league offered something a little different, ranging from redraft to dynasty setups and for the most part, each offered something different . create a league and customize league size, scoring and rules to play in the league you want to play .

title: Twins turn to David Festa in wake of Pablo Lopez injury
content: our fantasy baseball buzz file aims to provide fantasy managers with the intel they need as news breaks around baseball . a couple of the 13 games may see a sprinkle or two, but they are all supposed to play without a hitch .

title: Why Vasiliy Lomachenko was different from the rest
content: vasiliy Lomachenko announced his retirement from boxing on friday at age 37 . he leaves the sport as a three-division world champion with a professional record of 18-3 (12 KOs) a new wave of fans will look at his record and ask how a fighter with three losses in only 21 fights can be considered great .

title: Why are there so few women coaches in professional tennis?
content: her career came to an end in 2017 at the age of 25 . she was asked if she could temporarily help as she returned to the tour . but months turned into years, and she was hailed as a professional tennis player .

content: Shai Gilgeous-Alexander outplayed Tyrese Haliburton in a matchup of star point guards . he missed a clean midrange jumper, his specialty, that would have given the Thunder a three-point lead with 10 seconds left . the Pacers changed the narrative ... again .

content: the Pacers beat the Oklahoma City Thunder 111-110 in the NBA Finals . it is the latest game winner in a Finals game since Michael Jordan's in Game 1 . the 15-point comeback ties the largest fourth-quarter rally for a victory in the Finals over the past 50 years .
